questions.title: using ubuntu terminal windows app for lab
questions.content: dr hao, was able to find an ubuntu terminal app on the windows store that has the exact same functionality as the native terminal in ubuntu would this be sufficient for completion of the lab or should use virtual machine instead

responses.content: encourage you to try, and you will soon discover its limitations eg, you can't transfer files from windows to that mini ubuntu system, or you can't start 3rdparty text editor like atom

it's worth mentioning thatvs code, popular text editor similar to atom, has an extensionthat allows opening the text editor remotely from within that ubuntu subsystem once opened into folder in ubuntu, it functions just like it was running on linux natively same terminal and file access might be handy workaround to the limitations of the system that dr hao pointed out, although it will never be quite as goodas running linux proper

questions.title: how do you use text editor like atom
questions.content: was asked this question through emailhow do you use text editor like atom

responses.content: don't use atom, use vs code they are similar they mostly function as just text editor, however, while editing the files it does color the different words which represent different things on vs code you can use git from there, and you can run java in vs code's own terminali hope this answered your question

questions.title: ran into problem trying to dual boot windows and ubuntu
questions.content: hello everyone,as the title suggests, i'm wanting to dual boot my windows operating system with ubuntu have all the installations on my flashdrive and was able to get to the ubuntu trial menu now supposedly during the installation process there's supposed to be an option to run ubuntu alongside windows, but in my installation ubuntu only gives me the options to erase windows or to set the partitions myself i'm not sure why the option won't show up, but might assume it has to do with my hardrive storage my os has 18 tb of available space and 02 of that is used up by personal files software, images, games, etc was wondering if anyone has ever run into this issue before and was able to resolve the issue if so, any advice would be greatly appreciatedthanks in advance,isaiahps i'm in no rush to get this setup as i'm fine with using oncampus pcs to get my hw done if necessary, but would like to get this resolved at some point

responses.content: i've tried to do the exact same thing you've done, and also found that the only way to dualboot ubuntu with windows is seemingly to set the partitions yourself found guide that might help, it explains how to create each partition root, swap and home haven't followed it all the way through, but you might find it followed the tutorial to the end and my dualboot of ubuntu and windows is working nicelyupdate by the author of this question followed the instructions above and it worked one thing would want to warn people about though if you are like me, you'll have windows with uefi secure boot and you'll need to turn it off to dual boot when disabled it, while was able to use ubuntu just fine, was unable to access my windows os because it asked for bitlocker recovery key you get asked this for disabling secure boot if you are not sure where you have your bitlocker key id, make sure you find it before you install ubuntu, because if you are unable to find your recovery key, you will not br able to access your windows os luckly found it on my microsoft account on seperate pc and so was fine, but for those of you who are unsure where to find your recovery key, go herehttpsyoutubeazlgzldwniqhope this helps

questions.title: travis ci says i'm doing something wrong
questions.content: complied and ran this code in the ubuntu terminal today, and it successfully printed hello worldpublic class helloworld	public string getgreeting 			return hello world		public static void mainstring args			helloworld obj new helloworld		systemoutprintlnobjgetgreeting	but when ran it through travis ci, it failed to build see attached screenshots why doesn't it work here if it works in the ubuntu terminal fix suggestions hopefully simple unless really messed up would be most appreciatedcapturepngcapture2png

responses.content: you have to push the code that you've edited into github, which it looks like you have not if you look in capturepng, it's showing that it's still building with the first commit, labeled initial commitmake sure that you add the file to the commit the command below adds all changes that you have done in the current folder as well as the changes in the folders within your current folder as wellgit add then commit to your local repogit commit commit message change to whatever you didthen push the changes to your local repo to githubgit push

responses.content: updatedto align your output per line, you will need to use the tab character in your print statements you may need one or more characters in each line play around with it until the output lines upthis is not hard requirement
by output believe they mean the actual numbers, so you want to line up all the numbers you calculateex hours 4000gross pay 30000i know the math isn't correct

questions.title: lab2 clarifying rounding requirements
questions.content: the lab documentation says we shall round to the hundredth placedoes this mean, for example, if gross pay 2195, that we must print 21950, or is printing 2195 acceptablethank you

responses.content: i'd assume that rounding to the hundredths place does mean including the zero at the end of 21950in any case, adding an extra zero couldn't hurt
rounding applies to calculation printing with or without the trailing 0s are both okay

questions.content: finished my code and have had travis ci check, but it keeps coming out as failed the console in travis ci tests the code and gives me the expectedactual value of what my code put out but it doesn't line up with my personal tests and don't understand why for example, travis ci says when testing hours per week, that the expected value is 395 it then says my actual value was 5075 this doesn't make sense to me as when test it in the computers cmd, the value comes out as expected 395 any help would be greatly appreciatedsolved

questions.title: more problems with travis ci
questions.content: hello,my build is failing and have no idea why for some reason think it has to do with the testing file for netpay even though didn't even touch it in addition, ensured that was rounding in my netpay function but travis is still complainingnetpayfailpngnetpayfail2pngnetpayfail3pngnetpayfail4png

responses.content: your print statement is likely formatting the number to be rounded, but the actual stored value is unrounded solved this by making sure that when defined netpayvalue wrapped netpaynumberofhours in rounding method

questions.title: what does it mean to code method
questions.content: received several questions on the method netpay of lab2, which are all relevant to your conceptual understanding of methodsfunctions if you don't get it, you will meet more problems with lab3 list the questions below and hope you can do some research on the questions while waiting for other capable students chime inwhy do need netpay method like to code everything in main methodwhy do need to write the calculation and printing codes for two times, both under netpay and in the main method it seems redundantcan perform all my calculations in systemoutprintmy code seems to print everything as intended do still need netpay methodwhy do need methodsfunctions anyway what do they do

responses.content: splitting logic into reusable methods has several benefitsit drastically reduces duplicate code, thereby reducing file sizeit makes errors easier to manage, since problem with one method can be more easily isolated from the rest of the program and tested this is how most of the tests on travisci work, as far as can tellit can make the code easier to read as well, by splitting up the problem you can have individual, small, methods that you can easily figure out what they do, rather than needing tons of comments or to figure out what the code is doing this helps with figuring out errors tooyou don't need to know how method is implemented in order to use it java itself includes hundreds of builtin methods that you can use without knowing the details of how they work on system level systemoutprintln, stringequals, mathround, etc this is called abstraction

questions.title: travis issues
questions.content: travis is telling me that my code isn't rounding properly, but when run it in the terminal it displays the values that travis says it should however, travis is telling me that it isn't receiving the 2nd decimal place any suggestions

responses.content: since travis only checks the return statement and not the print output, would say that you should make sure your method is rounding both the calculations and the return output properlymake sure you are rounding to the 2nd decimal place this is from the lab instructions i'd take look at more problems with travis ci from earlier todayplease note that every calculation needs to be rounded to the hundredth 2nd decimal place, including the calculation of gross payment, federal tax, state tax, social security, medicare, and net pay you are expected to do some research and find how to do that on yourself

questions.title: confused about how to implement replacesingle without old character as parameter
questions.content: am having trouble understanding how it's possible to replace certain instance of character within the input string if the old character is not passed as parameter on the appendix within the google doc for lab 3, it shows that the user entering the old character is necessary for the program to know what to replace this brings me to my final question how would you be able to find instances of the old character without being able to access it within the replacesingle method i'm little confused herealso, there appears to be disparity between the instructions for implementation of the replacesingle method between the comments in the java file and on the google doc in the java comments, it says the method should replace the character at specified index with new character, but on the google doc, it says the method should replace specific instance of specified character with another i'm puzzled as to why there are two different descriptions of what the method should actually do

responses.content: there are other methods such as validateoccurance that will help you suggest you look at the skeleton for that method and it may help you determine how to implement your replacesingle methodfrom the description that comes with the method, it appears that the method is just supposed to take the character at index and replace it with newchar determining that index is something that will happen outside of the method the google doc describes what the userentered command replace single will do in the final product, which is not necessarily all taken care of in the replacesingle method, even though that would make sense

questionfor you to thinkshould replacesingle method take care of the tasks of finding the old characterif you see any mismatch between google doc and code skeleton, stick to the instruction of code skeleton in other words, do not change the parameters or method names

questions.title: validatestring method clarification lab3
questions.content: the description of this method makes me think it only validates string, but then the example given makes it seem like it also validates characters too should create separate validatechar method

responses.content: i'm not sure about that either, it does definitely seem like creating separate validatechar method would be good idea

if you see that as necessary, go ahead and create more helper methods some may see this as unnecessary, as you grab the char from the string, while the stringmakes processinguser inputexactly the same as elsewhere

questions.title: what is validateoccurance supposed to do
questions.content: think it is supposed to return the last index of char, as long as there are as many chars in the string as the number inputted, but i'm confused on what it is actually asking for

responses.content: it is supposed to return the index of the occurance of the char that you are looking for if it wants the 2nd occurance of character, but three of them exist, it'd return the index of the 2nd occurance

questions.title: using print reverse multiple times
questions.content: i've made printreverse function, and it can reverse given string multiple times, but whenever try to use it again, it prints out the reversed string instead of reversing back to the original one i'm pretty sure have to change my string variable to the new reversed string, but i'm not sure how to do that seeing as my function prints the reversed string but doesn't return ithow would retrieve my reversed string and make my original string variable equal to the reversed stringany help would be greatly appreciated

responses.content: if you look at the examples, the reversed string is never saved off this is from page of the lab instructionsenter the string to be manipulatedco dawgsenter your command quit, print reverse, replace all, replace single, removeprint reversesgwad ocenter your command quit, print reverse, replace all, replace single, removereplace singleskip few lines, and then you the initial, unreversed string even though reverse string was only called onceyour new sentence is go dawgsenter your command quit, print reverse, replace all, replace single, removequitthus, you don't need to save off or retrieve the reversed string

questions.title: loop on error
questions.content: for lab3 the instructions say that simple error message is sufficient if the user enters an invalid input would it be ok to have the user loop through their input until they enter valid character input in the appendix pasted below it shows the command being exited out of once the user enters an invalid int for the replacesingle method, and so i'm wondering if that applies to every inputyour new sentence is go dawgsenter your command quit, print reverse, replace all, replace single, removereplace singleenter the character to replacegenter the new charactercwhich would you like to replace2error the letter you are trying to replace does not existenter your command quit, print reverse, replace all, replace single, removequitintuitively feel like having the user loop through until they enter something valid would create the best user interactions, but at the same time i'm not sure if it's allowed

responses.content: this interpretation is wrongin the appendix pasted below it shows the command being exited out of once the user enters an invalid int for the replacesingle methodthesample interaction shows that there is supposed to loopyour new sentence is go dawgs enter your command quit, print reverse, replace all, replace single, remove replace single enter the character to replace enter the new character which would you like to replace error the letter you are trying to replace does not exist enter your command quit, print reverse, replace all, replace single, remove let me know if you find this difficult to understand

responses.content: we covered allthese questions like this in class time long time ago for future questions like this, you may need to reach out to your classmates for help this forum is not meant to replace lectures or make it convenient for anyone to skip lecturesby any meansfirst, which textbook are you referring to if you are talking about the supplement textbook we deployed on github, it's chapters 13second, there will be multiple choices, code reading and code writingthird, you can bring onepage doublesided cheat sheet no rules on what you can have on itfourth, we have mentioned what will be covered during lecture time when wewere talking about topic that is likely to appear in your midterm you have to seek help from your classmates on that

questions.title: scanner for lab4
questions.content: hi,in lab4 document it says, remember, your methods must work properly with any input we can provide, so test rigorouslydoes this mean that we are expected to test the methods in lab4 using scanner input, or is the input hardcoded in by the programmer

responses.content: since the methods and constructors take objects and numeric data types as parameters and not strings, think we are just supposed to make sure that our code can handle all possible inputs given those types, like making sure circle never has negative radius we don't have to worry about the user inputting empty strings or invalid numbers because if someone did decide to use the circle class with scanner input, all of these issues would have to be handled before the input was converted to doubles and passed to these methods

questions.title: need help rounding
questions.content: hi, am having difficulty rounding numbers again my area calculation is as followsreturn mathroundmathpi mathpowradius, 1000 1000and this is my code for testing the area calculationtest area method systemoutprintlntesting area measurement systemoutprintlnthe area of circle with circle is circlearea ninstead of outputting3483681 rounded to the third place the way want it, this code outputs, 34830 how do you fix this thanks

responses.content: this is what did to round my values to three decimal placesmathroundnum 10000 10000using mathround on the number multiplied by 10000 and then dividing that result by 10000 seemed to do the trick you can round to any number of decimal places by doing this with 10 to the power of however many decimal places you need used this strategy in lab 2, just with 1000 so it would round to decimal placesto add on to this, the root problem of the code provided initially is that the number would be rounded to whole integer every time, as you are only multiplyingdividing by 1000, not 10000 this can be fixed by either dividing by 10000, like above, or by type casting the mathround operation to double, as mathround outputs an int by default

this is specifically addressed in the lab4 document

questions.title: changing method parameters

responses.content: no, you can't change them, and there's no reason to the methods that don't use parameters don't need them

questions.title: can we change method parameters project
questions.content: hey all,this is similar to question that's already been asked for lab 5, but for project want to know if it's okay to change the method parameters for any of the given project methods it seems like should be able to because the default parameters for solvesudoku is only the 2d array of characters, and know need some way to keep track of where am in the board so adding extra parameters is the only solution that can think of to do thatthanks in advance,isaiah

responses.content: you aren't allowed to change the given method's parameters as assume it messes with how the labs are graded, but you are allowed to create helper methods with helper methods you could either overload the given methods or write new method that does what you want, however you choose to solve your code

you can always treat the given method as wrapper method andset the inner method of yours to accept more parameters wrapper methodpublic void givenmethodint var inner method mymethodvar, stringprivate void mymethodint var, string str do whatever want

questions.title: what to return for empty queuesstacks
questions.content: for lab 5, the instructions specifically say that, this problem only needs to work in the scope of integers, which take would mean any integer that's positive, negative, or zero, despite the example cases only including positive integers, unless i'm mistakenif that's the case, i'm confused as to what pop, top, remove and peek, which are the methods affected by empty queues and stacks, are supposed to return to signify an empty queuestack to the user, because they require thati return an int in all scenarios, and usual practices like or wouldn't be idealhere, because they could just be normal valuesi don't know if just printing something is enough for this or not, but just wanna be sureadding on to this, normal stack will throw emptystackexception when pop or top is used on an empty stack and queue will throw nosuchelementexception when remove is used on an empty queue are we to throw these same exceptions or just inform the user that their attempted action is invalid an empty queue will return null when peek is called on it, are we to return null as well

responses.content: this is good question that you should try to answer in your code see the lab instructionyou may not assume that all operations are valid for example, pop or peek operations might be called on an empty stack how do you address such scenarios in your codea hint on this can you recall some methods that we covered that can end the execution of method abruptly, likesystemexit

questions.title: isparticallyvalid
questions.content: hey guys,i was wondering why isparticallyvalid takes two points for it's parameters when it seems like it'll work fine given only one point to check the row, column, and squarethankskirsten

responses.content: you need to think that this method checks an area in the given 2d sudoku board using two points top left corner and right bottom corner is conventional way to stand for an area, as it works for anything regardlessly if you are talking about row, column, or squareyou can certainly use number to stand for row ie, row number, but this representation doesn't work for squarefor this project, if you stick to the requirement of the parameters, the feedback you see from travis may better help you, and it also makes our grading little bit easier

questions.title: an error with one of the practice solutions
questions.content: hello all,hope studies are going well so have question from the linked list lecture slide if you've read through this lecture slide, you'll find the solution to practice is public listnode plusonelistnode head listnode headreverse reverselisthead listnode cur headreverse int extra curdata while cur null curdata curdata extra if curdata 10 curdata curdata 10 extra else extra cur curnext if extra curnext new listnodeextra return reverselistheadreverse if you haven't looked at this problem yet, the goal is to add to linked list eg 123null becomes 124null now correct me if i'm wrong, but think there's something wrong with this line if extra curnext new listnodeextrathe problem see is that we're trying to assign curnext to our new listnode, but curnext doesn't exist because the while loop runs until cur is pointing to null therefore, by the end of our loop, our cur pointer isn't pointing to listnode object and so it should throw an error if we call curnext right just wanted to see if i'm right on this

responses.content: that looks like an error, but an easytofix one public listnode plusonelistnode head listnode headreverse reverselisthead listnode cur headreverse int extra curdata while cur null curdata curdata extra if curdata 10 curdata curdata 10 extra else extra if curnext null cur curnext else break if extra curnext new listnodeextra return reverselistheadreverse
